chargeHist.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent
Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey Gene Thundercloud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  All restitution is joint and several with co-defendant, Joshua Edgerton, Jackson County case 15CF123.

Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.   If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Must seek and maintain full-time employment which is satisfactory to your agent.  Defendant  must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent.  Once employment is obtained you must setup a payment plan to re-pay the restitution 1st and then the court costs.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants.  Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  You shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person with any of the victims in this case, including the fire fighter and his family unless they contact the department of corrections and the contact is deemed appropriate by your agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Defendant must submit to random PBT's by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.  Defendant must submit to random urinalysis by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.  Must comply with any other recommendations of your agent for programming/counseling/treatment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #6
Associated with Charge #5
Associated with Charge #3
Associated with Charge #2
Associated with Charge #2
of 7/12/16 sentencing hearing
from  R.P.
Restitution Worksheet with corrected total of $32,103.67
Amended
DNA submission form.
4 forms and cards mailed out
Amended (Redacted version)

Defendant appears in custody in person with counsel SPD William Poss.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Agent Miles is also present as the write of the PSI for 15CF124.  Judge states 15CM173 was left open as victims weren't notified appropriately.  DA Fox does not have any info they've made contact with the victim and moves to dismiss.  Court grants dismissal on 14CM173.  There is some incorrect information in the PSI regarding other cases.  Court stated clarification made on 15CM153, 14CF113, and 14CM159 were dismissed outright correctly.  Other charges in some other cases were correctly DRI.  Judge asks defense is they would like some information in the current PSI redacted so there isn't a problem in the future.  SPD Poss states his client and he believe the PSI should be redacted and wishes to proceed today.  Court states anything related to offense dates other than 15CF124, both offense dates should be 7/17/15.  Anything not related to this date will not be considered today.  Court asks the agent if this changes her recommendation and she answers no.  DA Fox asks victims to address the Court at this time if they wish and that they be allowed to do so.  C.D., victim makes a statement to the Court.  M.B., victim makes statement to the Court.  Joint recommendation presented by the State of:  Counts 2 & 3 - Each 5 years initial confinement with 5 years ES, concurrent to each other; Counts 5 & 6 - Each 5 years initial confinement and 5 years ES, concurrent to each other but consecutive to Counts 2 & 3; total of 20 years bifurcated to 10 years initial confinement plus 10 years extended supervision.  State gives argument for basis of recommendation.  There 360 days sentence credit per DA Fox.  Restitution requested as listed on the Restitution Worksheet previously filed for a total of $31,103.67 and should be joint/several with co-defendant Joshua Edgerton, 15CF123.  SPD Poss makes statement to the Court and asks the Court to adopt the joint recommendation.  Defendant excercises his right to allocution.  Defense is in agreement with restitutuion request/restitution worksheet.  Court makes statement regarding incorrect information in PSI.  Court adopts the joint recommendation of counsel and orders:  Counts 2 & 3 - 10 years bifurcated to 5 years initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision, counts are concurrent; Counts 5 & 6 - 10 years bifurcated to 5 years initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision; counts are concurrent but consecutive to Counts 2 & 3.  Court orders the following extended supervision conditions:  Must submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.  Must undergo a risk and needs assessment and comply with any recommended treatment/counseling/programming.  Must pay the costs of the action and the cost of supervision.  Must seek and maintain full-time employment approved by agent.  Must repay restitution as requested per the restitution worksheet for a total of $31,103.67 and pay the surcharges.  Restitution is ordered joint and several with co-defendant, Joshua Edgerton, 15CF123.  Shall have no contact of any kind with any of the victims in this case, or the fire fighter listed as a victim, or his family unless any victim contacts the probation agent requesting contact and the agent deems that contact is appropriate.  Must undergo an AODA assessment and must comply with any recommendations.  Must undergo random drug testing and random alcohol testing.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Attorney Poss will file a completed postconviction form.  Court finds defendant eligible for both CIP and SAP and grants 360 days sentence credit on Counts 2 & 3.  Court orders DOC to file a redacted PSI and the one on file will not go to the prison with him. To be filed as soon as agent can get it done.
Routed to Judge electronically & copies sent to DA and SPD
Allowing Substitution of Counsel

I talked to SPD Fredrickson and he said there will not be an Order filed at this time and the J.O. is aware that William Poss is already handling this case.  He said a PDOAC will be filed at some point.  I sent the document down to the Judge.
To Substitute as Counsel
Amended.  Faxed entire packet to probation.
Sentencing hearing on July 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Not signed by defendant

Defendant appeared in custody from Jackson County Jail with counsel SPD Paul Fredrickson; SPD William Poss not present.  There is a joint recommendation that he will plead to Counts 2, 3, 5, 6 in the amended information; Counts 1 & 4 will be dismissed; other cases to be DRI.  Victims were not notifed in 14CM173 as their notices came back undelivered so that case will continue to track with 15CF124.  Other cases the victims were either properly notified or there wasn't any restitution requested.  Defense wishes to proceed today even though 14CM173 will not be addressed today.  Court reviews the charges/potential penalties for the charges in the amended information which adds Counts 5 & 6.  Defendant pleads No contest to Counts 2, 3, 5, 6.  Court reviews elements of charges, plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  Court notes that the plea questionnaire shows he is actually pleading guilty but he is pleading no contest to the charges.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  Defense stipulates that there is a factual basis for the pleas, have discussed repeater penalty & consequences of felony convictions.  Court finds the defendant freely, knowingly, and intelligently makes his plea and waives his rights; he understands the proceedings.  Court finds guilty in 15CF124 on Counts 2, 3, 5, 6; Counts 1 & 4 are dismissed and read-in.  Cases 14CM159, 15CM113, 14CF153 are all dismissed  outright.  14CM173 will continue to track with this case until sentencing.  Court orders a PSI and it is due by  no later than 6-10-16.  The sentencing will be scheduled by counsel for a date no sooner than 6/28/16 and not on a Monday.  Bond is continued and defendant is remanded to JASO.
Restitution worksheet
PLEAH rescheduled at email request of Atty Fredrickson due to scheduling conflict. Ok'd with Tanya at DA's office.
Plea hearing on May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on April 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference at 02-29-2016 03:00 pm
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorneys Poss and Fredrickson appeared.  Waive reading of information.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by the court.  STC set for 2/29/16 at 3 pm.
Arraignment at 02-01-2016 03:45 pm
Defense requesting cash bond be lowered to $1,000.00, and add electronic monitoring to the bond conditions.  State objects.  Court denied request.  Bond continued as previously ordered.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Fredrickson.  Court reviewed the waiver form with the defendant.  Defendant stated that he understood the waiver.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and  knowingly  waived his right to a preliminary hearing.  Probable cause found.
Defendant's Special Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on Detective Kelly Bakken to appear at the preliminary hearing on 1-08-16
Preliminary hearing at 01-08-2016 03:30 pm
Preliminary hearing at 12-08-2015 03:30 pm
Defendant's
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Poss.  Tracking with 14CF153.

Pre-trial conference at 09-09-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 09-28-2015 03:00 pm.

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of time limits.  He understands.  Court finds the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Fredrickson.  Reading of complaint waived.    Set for PTC 9/9/15.  & STC 9/28/15 at 3 pm

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail without counsel.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties.  Defendant understood.  Defendant has contacted SPD.  AIA set for 8/17/15 at 9:30 am.  Cash bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance at 08-17-2015 09:30 am

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: C. D.; D. P.; R. P.; M. B. victims
